definition: to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
Chitu district of Keelung City 基隆市[Ji1 long2 shi4], Taiwan
Chitu district of Keelung City 基隆市[Ji1 long2 shi4], Taiwan
(coll.) to catch an adulterous couple in the act
to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
A small hole not plugged will sink a great ship.
pinyin: xiao3 dong4 bu4 du3 chen2 da4 chuan2

sentences.english: The ID of the SER cold end is normally plugged.
sentences.chinese: SER型硅碳棒的冷端部的內徑通常是堵上的。

sentences.english: The next morning when I opened the window I was astonished to find out what a grand mountain.
sentences.chinese: 第二天清早推窗，才一驚，好一座大山，堵着天。

sentences.english: The hydraulic profile control and water shutoff pump is a hydraulic driven reciprocating pump with double cylinders and single action.
sentences.chinese: 液壓調剖堵水泵是一種液壓驅動的雙缸單作用往復泵。

sentences.english: The road, as he drew near Umbrella Street, was jammed once again;
sentences.chinese: 接近雨傘街的時候，路又堵上了。

sentences.english: Some people joked that Beijing blocked a car one day only, from morning to night block.
sentences.chinese: 有人開玩笑，北京一天只堵一次車，從早堵到晚。

sentences.english: The manager got caught in the morning rush hour.
sentences.chinese: 經理在早晨交通尖峯時段堵在車龍里。

sentences.english: They stopped the hole with a big rock.
sentences.chinese: 他們用一塊大岩石把洞堵上了。

sentences.english: You're on your way somewhere, when suddenly you find yourself stuck in traffic.
sentences.chinese: 你正開着車前往某處，忽然發現自己被堵在車流中了。

sentences.english: It is closer, yes, but the road is terribly jammed.
sentences.chinese: 近是近，可是路堵得厲害。

sentences.english: Is the blocking of your nose getting better?
sentences.chinese: 你鼻子堵的情況好一些嗎？

sentences.english: The field to respond calmly and a few words will sister wang blocked back.
sentences.chinese: 田野冷靜應對，幾句話將王姐堵了回去。

sentences.english: We could be stuck here for hours.
sentences.chinese: 我們可能會被堵在這裏好幾個小時。

sentences.english: She jumped over the low wall.
The monthly examination of automatic drain valve is a dirty block, such as dirty block clean.
sentences.chinese: 每月需檢查自動排水閥是否有髒堵，如髒堵請清洗。

sentences.english: The monthly examination of automatic drain valve is a dirty block, such as dirty block clean.
sentences.chinese: 每月需檢查自動排水閥是否有髒堵，如髒堵請清洗。

sentences.english: It's rush hour now; that road may be blocked .
sentences.chinese: 現在是交通高峯期，那條路可能堵着呢。

definition: to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
to squeeze through/to force one's way through
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
to unblock/to dredge/to clear the way/to get things flowing/to facilitate/to mediate/to lobby/to explicate (a text)
to choke/to stifle/to restrain/to hold back/to hold in (urine)/to hold (one's breath)
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
